alert.note: Alert for Sabine; San Augustine (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 8:16PM CST until January 04 at 7:42PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following bayou in Texas... Ayish Bayou Near San Augustine affecting Sabine and San Augustine Counties. For the Ayish Bayou...including San Augustine...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ayish Bayou Near San Augustine. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Lowland flooding of the heavily wooded floodplain will continue for the next several days. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM CST Tuesday was 13.2 feet with this crest. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 9.1 feet by Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Wednesday evening by 945 AM CST.
